alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 8:28PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Somerset, southwestern Worcester and northern Accomack Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 828 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Marion Station, or 9 miles south of Princess Anne, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, West Pocomoke, Westover, Marion Station, Horntown, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Fairmount, Upper Hill, Hopewell, Rehobeth, Kingston, Shelltown, Manokin, Upper Fairmount, Oak Hall, Beaver Dam, Atlantic, Girdletree and Stockton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
